radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder appears distended with surrounding inflammatory changes and wall edema. There is a punctate hyperdensity within the gallbladder neck compatible with a stone. The pancreas, spleen, and bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable. Unenhanced kidneys demonstrate no nephrolithiasis. Bilateral cortical hypodensities characterized as simple cysts. Abdominal aorta shows moderate atherosclerotic calcifications, with an infrarenal aorta aneurysmal measuring 3.5 x 2.5 cm. The colon shows moderate diverticular disease without diverticulitis.
